projects.title: BRAIN COMPUTER INTERFACE SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT THROUGH EEG SIGNAL CLASSIFICATION
projects.description: -Extracted optimal statistical parameters from MI Dataset(IIIa and IVa) for representation of Brain Connectivity in Motor Imagery Task-Computed the weights between atoms and test data and designed a locality constrained dictionary for Sparse Representation classifier-Analyzing Brain Connectivity alterations between Information Encoding and Retrieval processes during a Visual Working Memory task

projects.title: STRUCTURAL HEALTH MONITORING OF RAILROAD TRACKS USING SELF POWERED VIBRATION SENSORS
projects.description: -Proposed a novel approach of Sensor-harvester sharing and multiple harvester fusion with Piezoelectric transducer using track vibrations-Amalgamated the concept of data-driven modeling and Machine Learning based architectures within standalone low power sensing edge devices through the utilization of Rail Spring Mass Damper modeling and Characteristic Frequency Spectrum of Vibrational Acceleration-Assembled power-efficient communication and node clustering, using wake-on-call GPRS module for mapping health data of rail track

projects.title: SAMPLING FOR DISTRIBUTED DETECTION OF REMOTE SOURCE
projects.description: -Studied the Decision criteria, implemented Binary MAP detection for vector observations and Neymar Pearson rule for hypothesis testing-Formulated optimum local and global sampling strategy, and decision rule to detect the source using multiple sensors dispersed spatially-For the prescribed global probability of false alarm, found optimum local and global decision rules to minimize the global probability of miss
